title: Kafka topic name with dot is failing
body:
### Describe the bug

Kafka supports the topic names with dot symbol. 
eg: below are valid topic names:
employee.salary
public.customer.purchase
private.grocery.vegetables.sale
 
Quarkus is failing to handle such names. For example from the [kafka-quickstart](https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus-quickstarts/tree/main/kafka-quickstart) application, in the [processor](https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus-quickstarts/blob/main/kafka-quickstart/processor/src/main/java/org/acme/kafka/processor), changing the outgoing topic name from 'quotes' to 'quotes.ch' will result in the failure with the below exception ::

`Failed to start application (with profile dev) java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: SRMSG00071: Invalid channel configuration - the connector attribute must be set for channel quotes at io.smallrye.reactive.messaging.providers.impl.ConnectorConfig.lambda$new$0(ConnectorConfig.java:50) at java.base/java.util.Optional.orElseThrow(Optional.java:403) at io.smallrye.reactive.messaging.providers.impl.ConnectorConfig.lambda$new$1(ConnectorConfig.java:50) at java.base/java.util.Optional.orElseGet(Optional.java:364) at io.smallrye.reactive.messaging.providers.impl.ConnectorConfig.(ConnectorConfig.java:49) at io.smallrye.reactive.messaging.providers.impl.ConfiguredChannelFactory.lambda$extractConfigurationFor$0(ConfiguredChannelFactory.java:85) at java.base/java.lang.Iterable.forEach(Iterable.java:75) at io.smallrye.reactive.messaging.providers.impl.ConfiguredChannelFactory.extractConfigurationFor(ConfiguredChannelFactory.java:74)`

Tried the below options, didn't work

1.  the property with single quote
mp.messaging.outgoing.'quotes.ch'.value.serializer=io.quarkus.kafka.client.serialization.ObjectMapperSerializer

2. also with double quote
mp.messaging.outgoing."quotes.ch".value.serializer=io.quarkus.kafka.client.serialization.ObjectMapperSerializer

and with/without connector property mapping to kafka-connector 

### Expected behavior

Quarkus should be able to identify the topic names containing 'dot' separation. Quarkus should support the naming convention of topics and channels in line with kafka.

### Actual behavior

Failing with java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: SRMSG00071

### How to Reproduce?

1. Clone [kafka-quickstart](https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus-quickstarts/tree/main/kafka-quickstart) repository
2. Change the name of the topic in the [processor](https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus-quickstarts/blob/main/kafka-quickstart/processor/src/main/java/org/acme/kafka/processor), from 'quotes' to 'quotes.ch' in all the occurrences
3. execute mvn -f processor quarkus:dev 


### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

_No response_

### Output of `java -version`

11+

### GraalVM version (if different from Java)

_No response_

### Quarkus version or git rev

2.8

### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`)

maven 3.8.5

### Additional information

_No response_
